text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
Christmas wreath pull apart cupcake cake
tutorial where I'll be showing you how
to make a great full-size Christmas
wreath cake that actually pulls apart
into individual cupcake sized portions
tools and equipment that we will be
using today I'm using 24 cupcakes I'm
using a mixture of red velvet we have a
great recipe on our channel if you're
looking for a good red velvet cupcake
recipe and I'm also using just some
vanilla cupcakes I've got a 16 inch
wooden board a cake board that I've iced
with some red fondant so we've also got
a tutorial on how to ice a board for
great presentation I just lined that
with a little bit of Christmassy gold
ribbon
I've pre-made a fondant bow once again I
have a tutorial on my channel on how to
make those fondant bows I would suggest
if you would like to one of these boats
you should do it a day or two in advance
you can see there I've just made mine
about five minutes ago so it's still got
its little tissues or bits of cotton
wool in there as it dries we'll still
use it for this tutorial but ideally I
would have liked to have had that set
for a day or two before I pop it on this
cake I've got some chopped orange balls
or JAF as we call them in Australia if
you can't find Jeffers or chug orange
balls where you are you can use a red
Krispies M&Ms red peanut M&Ms red
regular M&Ms or you can roll small balls
of red fondant or modeling chocolate
I've got some spearmint leaf candies if
you don't have spearmint leaf candies
you can cut some holly leaves out of
green fondant or green modeling
chocolate
I've put some of our perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting and I've colored
that just a nice Christmasy green color
we've got a recipe for that frosting on
our channel if you'd like to have a look
and I've got a piping bag which I've pre
filled with that green frosting I'm
using that stay in conjunction with the
loyal number nine piping nozzle also
known as a thermo nozzle they're the
large plastic piping nozzles I would
normally use a slightly larger star this
one here's just a little bit narrower
because I want to go for more of like I
guess a rustic leafy effect so you can
see there I've got that frosting just
popping at the end of that lovely
star-shaped nozzle and I'll leave all
this information in the comment section
of this tutorial as I mentioned I'm
using 24 cupcakes today so I've lined up
my first things about 14 or so they're
going to take the remaining ones now
I've just positioned this I haven't
stuck them to the board or anything like
that they are just sitting on the board
so the frosting is going to act like the
glue that holds them all together and I
really just worked them around until I'm
happy that they're giving me a nice
circle shape they're all evenly placed
in there then I'm going to a second
layer of cupcakes on the inside so it's
a nice nice thick Holly sorry a nice
thick wreath there we go so we're just
positioning those once they're in there
you just want to move them around so
that they're as close to that outside
row as possible without too many big
gaps in the middle lovely all right so
from here we're going to take that
piping bag and I'm just going to do I
guess the equivalent to our low swirl
frosting style so we would normally do
this with a non star shaped nozzle but
I'm just going to start in the center of
the cupcake and squeezing coming out to
the edge you don't want to take this
frosting too high and you want to take
it right out over the edge of that patty
pan just go around the cake of the
cupcakes and we want to frost all of
those up see how when I'm frosting I'm
actually joining up each cupcake with
the frosting so you go right over the
patty pan or the cupcake case coming
into the second layer and once again we
want to join up with that frosting so
you should have something that looks
like this now to fix up any of those
little holes and gaps I'm just going to
take that frosting and just type in some
little frosting gap fillers I suppose
now if they're quite large gaps make
sure that you're taking that frosting
all the way down to the cake board and
not just filling the gap on top so I'm
actually letting the frosting sit on the
cake board and then building it up to
fill in that gap that's going to give us
a nice full sized cake look and it's
going to make sure that we don't lose
any of those gap fillers if we just put
it on the top it'll just fall straight
through if the weather gets bit warm or
once it starts to settle a little bit
all right so now it's time to make our
little Holly details so we're going to
take those red balls and you can just
position these wherever you like but I
just thought it'd be nice to do some
little decoration you type Holly looking
the things on there just some of those
spearmint leaves probably would look a
little bit nicer if you did have the
holly leaves cut out of fondant
but not everybody has fondant cutters
and holly leaf cutters and all that sort
of stuff sitting at home so this is a
great a great cupcake pull apart reef
cake for people if they just want to or
if you guys just want to go to your
local store and pick up things that you
can find in the confectionary aisle if
you love our tutorials make sure that
you subscribe to our channel we upload
three times a week and we've always got
great new tutorials coming out we also
love to hear your feedback so if you're
enjoying our tutorials please let us
know and if there's something you'd like
to see certainly request it and if we
can make it for you we will all right
now the final touch on this cake for me
and you don't have to do this this is a
total optional extra you can't just keep
going with your Holly's around the
bottom but I think it looks really nice
just popping this lovely big bow now as
I mentioned I would have preferred to
have made that a couple of days in
advance and had it set but I think
you'll agree that's going to be a lovely
talking point at your Christmas table
and fantastically easy for the kids and
the big kids to just grab a pace wander
off and eat and enjoy thanks very much
for watching
